evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: In 2002, Congress enacted, and the President signed, the Education Sciences Reform Act of 2002, Pub. L. 107-279.

extracted.value: Congress enacted Education Sciences Reform Act of 2002, Pub. L. 107-279

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The statute transferred the duties to undertake several existing research initiatives to IES, including the National Assessment of Educational Progress (NAEP)… the Institute of Education Sciences (IES), and four National Centers of Research within it.

extracted.value: Institute of Education Sciences (IES) and four National Centers were established

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants have made the decision to terminate IES’s work and taken steps to effectuate that decision… (1) canceled contracts en masse that either directly implement IES’s statutory responsibilities…

extracted.value: Defendants canceled contracts en masse

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (2) as part of a “reduction in force,” eliminated approximately 90% of the staff positions at IES—including nearly all positions that oversee and coordinate statutorily mandated research;

extracted.value: Defendants eliminated approximately 90% of IES staff positions

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: (3) terminated outside researchers’ remote access to data.

extracted.value: Defendants terminated outside researchers’ remote access to data

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: ED, at the apparent instruction of DOGE, “terminated for convenience” two contracts for the National Postsecondary Student Aid Study (NPSAS)…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the National Postsecondary Student Aid Study (NPSAS)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: ED terminated the contract for the High School and Beyond Longitudinal Study of 2020…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the High School and Beyond Longitudinal Study of 2020

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: ED terminated the contract for the Early Childhood Longitudinal Study‑Kindergarten (ECLS‑K:2024)…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for Early Childhood Longitudinal Study-Kindergarten (ECLS‑K:2024)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: ED terminated contracts for the National Teacher and Principal Survey…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the National Teacher and Principal Survey

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: ED also terminated the contracts necessary to the Common Core of Data and the Private School Survey…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the Common Core of Data and Private School Survey

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: ED also terminated the contract for the National Assessment of Adult Education…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the National Assessment of Adult Education

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants also terminated contracts for the evaluation of the DC Opportunity Scholarship Program…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for DC Opportunity Scholarship Program evaluation

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants terminated contracts necessary for the Condition of Education, a report…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the Condition of Education report

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants terminated the contracts by which the agency was complying with the public dissemination and performance management requirements… including the contract for its “DATALAB” web platform…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the Datalab web platform

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: … and contracts for its What Works Clearinghouse…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the What Works Clearinghouse

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants terminated the contracts for the National Library of Education’s contracts for interlibrary loans…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contracts for the National Library of Education interlibrary loans

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: … and the contract for the NCES’s mail center…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated contract for the NCES mail center

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Since the initial tranche of contract cancellations, ED has continued to cancel contracts that allow IES to function… including the ten statutorily required Regional Educational Laboratories…

extracted.value: Defendants continued to cancel contracts for Regional Educational Laboratories (RELs)

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants terminated one of the components of the National Assessment for Educational Progress, the long‑term assessment for age 17.

extracted.value: Defendants terminated one component of NAEP age‑17 assessment

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants canceled the contract to develop a “centralized, streamlined, and more efficient approach to disseminating research and statistics to stakeholders”…

extracted.value: Defendants canceled contract to develop a centralized research dissemination approach

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: As a result of the termination of contracts, hundreds of millions of dollars that have already been spent were wasted… data that was collected and/or maintained by contractors was lost.

extracted.value: Defendants’ actions caused loss of data, research, and services

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, IES informed all remote restricted‑use data license holders that those licenses would be terminated effective June 1 2025…

extracted.value: Defendants terminated remote restricted‑use data licenses effective June 1 2025

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Defendants also canceled contracts necessary to the Common Core of Data… and contracts for its What Works Clearinghouse…

extracted.value: Defendants canceled contracts for peer review services without replacement

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The RIF eliminated the positions of nearly all of the staff in NCER, NCES, and NCEE—leaving approximately 20 employees.

extracted.value: Defendants eliminated staff positions at NCER, NCES, and NCEE, leaving approximately 20 employees

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The RIF included the only librarian position at the National Library of Education…

extracted.value: Defendants eliminated the librarian position at the National Library of Education

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: The Director of Information Technology and the Information Security Specialist… were subject to the RIF.

extracted.value: Defendants eliminated Information Technology and Information Security Specialist positions

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: I.E.S employees lost physical access to ED facilities as of March 11, 2025, and were given limited IT access…

extracted.value: Defendants caused staff loss of access to ED facilities and IT systems

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: until I was placed on administrative leave on March 21, 2025

extracted.value: Abigail Doe was placed on administrative leave on March 21, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: I worked in the National Center for Education Evaluation and Regional Assistance (NCEE), which is part of the Institute of Education Sciences (IES)

extracted.value: Abigail Doe worked at the National Center for Education Evaluation and Regional Assistance (NCEE), part of the Institute of Education Sciences (IES), prior to her administrative leave.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: I am familiar with the Regional Educational Laboratories (RELs) and the What Works Clearinghouse (WWC)

extracted.value: Abigail Doe is familiar with the Regional Educational Laboratories (RELs) and the What Works Clearinghouse (WWC).

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: On February 10, 2025, I attended an emergency meeting with other NCEE staff at which we were told that all of our contracts were being canceled by DOGE except for the REL contracts

extracted.value: On February 10, 2025, Abigail Doe attended an emergency meeting with other NCEE staff in which she was told that all contracts were being canceled except for REL contracts.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: just three days later on February 13, a colleague received an email from the Contracts and Acquisitions Management office informing them that the REL contract they managed was being canceled after all

extracted.value: On February 13, 2025, Abigail Doe received an email from the Contracts and Acquisitions Management office informing them that the REL contract they managed was being canceled after all.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: the Department posted a press release on its website stating that the REL contracts were canceled as “woke spending.”

extracted.value: On February 13, 2025, the Department posted a press release on its website stating that the REL contracts were canceled as “woke spending.”

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: Shortly thereafter, the contracts for all of the other RELs were also canceled.

extracted.value: After February 13, 2025, all other REL contracts were also canceled.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: We were told nothing about the reasons for the contract cancellations.

extracted.value: Abigail Doe was told nothing about the reasons for the contract cancellations.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: for example, each of the RELs was tasked with creating a toolkit for teachers and other practitioners to use based on a What Works Clearinghouse Practice Guide, and when the contracts were canceled in February, nine of the ten RELs had already completed their toolkits and were conducting efficacy studies to make sure the toolkits led to improved student outcomes

extracted.value: Nine of the ten RELs had completed toolkits and were conducting efficacy studies when the contracts were canceled, representing waste of taxpayer money.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: staff were working on three practice guides that were nearly complete when the contracts were canceled in mid-February

extracted.value: Some practice guides were nearly complete when their contracts were canceled.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: the peer review contract in the Standards and Review Office (SRO) was also canceled

extracted.value: The peer review contract in the Standards and Review Office (SRO) was canceled.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: but then almost everyone received RIF notices and was ordered to stop working as of March 21

extracted.value: After February 13, 2025, many staff received RIF notices and were ordered to stop working as of March 21, creating uncertainty about continuation of statutory work.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: neither I nor any other NCEE colleague was tasked with re-establishing the REL program

extracted.value: No one was tasked to re-establish the REL program after its termination.

evidence.source_document: Declaration of Abigail Doe
evidence.text: there is only one staff member left at NCEE

extracted.value: Only one staff member remained at NCEE after the termination of contracts.
